original: rnam pa gang gis lam gang dag tu gang zhig dmigs par bya ba'i rnam pa de dag dang / lam de dag dang / dngos po de thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis /

translated: If one knows the distinctions of the varieties of the path of insight, then it is only the path of insight, not the path of cultivation, because the distinction of stages is possible in the former, but not in the latter, since all stages are undifferentiated in mere aspiration.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba la yang ming dang / dpe dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / bsdu ba'i sgo nas bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi byed pa shes par bya'o //

translated: One should understand the varieties of these two paths in terms of name, example, intrinsic nature, and inclusion, as they are.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rab tu dbye bas bsdus la /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rab tu dbye bas bsdus la /
translated: All the aspects of the spirit of enlightenment are included in its character, objective, and varieties.

analyzed: des na ma tshang ba dang ltag par srid pa'i dogs pa mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not doubt that the spirit of enlightenment is incomplete or in error.

original: de la las dang po pa ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis dang / mthong bas thos pa dang rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: de la las dang po pa ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis dang / mthong bas thos pa dang rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: The beginner is of three types: the one who has faith, the one who follows the teaching, and the one who has insight.

original: de'i dbye bas sa tha dad pa yin gyi dngos su ni las dang po pa'i sa la dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbye bas sa tha dad pa yin gyi dngos su ni las dang po pa'i sa la dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The stages are differentiated by these, but in reality there is no differentiation on the stage of the beginner.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dun pa dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sgras sems la byung ba gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dun pa dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sgras sems la byung ba gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the terms aspiration, intention, and superior intention refer to the mental activities.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i nges 'byed kyi cha la gnas pa ni 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i nges 'byed kyi cha la gnas pa ni 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
translated: The small, medium, and great stages of penetration, which will be explained, are the path of application.

original: sa dang po mthong ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir na gnyis pa la sogs pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub po //

translated: Since the first stage is the path of insight, the second and so on are the path of cultivation, which is differentiated by the small, medium, and great stages.

original: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa na me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga sgrub pa'i byed pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa na me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga sgrub pa'i byed pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: When one enters the eleventh stage, the stage of the Buddha, there are five functions of establishing the five knowledges, such as the mirror knowledge.

analyzed: gal te sems bskyed pa gcig pu nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir na /
translated: If one attains buddhahood by generating the thought alone,

analyzed: gal te gzhi med pa'i rnam pa tsam bsgom par nus na 'di bden pa zhig @257b na /

analyzed: dmigs pa dang gnyen po'i khyad par dang bral ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is impossible to have a special aspect divorced from the special objective and antidote.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun mkhyen gsum yul yin par brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun mkhyen gsum yul yin par brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the object of the three knowledges,

original: so sor yul du byas pa rnams rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor yul du byas pa rnams rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to the realization of all aspects of the object of each knowledge.

original: yongs su shes par byas pa'i kun mkhyen gsum nyid dbang du byas pa'i don du yang rnam pa thams cad dang / lam dang / gzhi shes pas bsdus pas kun mkhyen gsum nyid sgom par byed do zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di nyid yin no //

translated: The meaning of this is that one cultivates the three knowledges, i.e., the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the paths, and the knowledge of bases, in order to bring about the three knowledges, i.e., the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the paths, and the knowledge of bases, which are fully known.

analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin la //

analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag la rlom sems med pa'i phyir dus thams cad sems zhum pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis theg pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: sems brten pa yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir na the tshom dang phyin ci log dang bral bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar na las dang po'i sa nas brtsams te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gdams ngag gis byang chub kyi sems sgrub pa rnam par dag pa yin no //
